subject: RE: [junit] System.exit
msgSnippet: ... A possible workaround is to define a SecurityManager which does not allow to call System.exit(). Then, catch SecurityException in the test*() method.
messageBody:
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Mike Lepine [mailto:mike.lepine@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, July 10, 2001 1:18 AM
> To: Junit
> Subject: [junit] System.exit
>
> I've come across a method that I would like to write a test for
> but it calls
> System.exit within its definition. Is there any way that a test can be
> written for this situation?

A possible workaround is to define a SecurityManager which does not allow to
call System.exit(). Then, catch SecurityException in the test*() method.

--oleg
